news.title: Gurugram moves ahead with phase-I construction bids for new metro corridor
news.para: Gurugram is set to enhance its metro connectivity. GMRL will likely award the contract for the Millennium City Centre-Cyber City metro's first phase soon. Construction is expected to begin by September. The initial phase includes a 15.2km elevated line with 14 stations. This project aims to improve connectivity to residential and commercial areas.

news.title: Maharashtra: Housing experts raise red flags over Darekar panel report on self-redevelopment
news.para: Housing activists are criticizing the Pravin Darekar committee's self-redevelopment recommendations, arguing they weaken key benefits from the 2019 GR and introduce new obstacles for middle-class homeowners. Concerns include the reduced FSI incentive, the 30-year age eligibility criterion, and the shift in TDR procurement discounts. Activists are urging a review to address these issues and ensure a supportive self-redevelopment policy.

news.title: Hyderabad's Old City corridor to affect 900 properties
news.para: Hyderabad Metro Rail's MGBS to Chandrayangutta corridor road widening is progressing, with property impact reduced to 900 through redesign. Challenges include dense housing and utility lines, addressed by cautious night work. Groundwork for metro construction is underway, including soil testing and DGPS surveys to finalize pillar locations, minimizing disruption to historical sites.

news.title: Housing societies in Maharashtra cautioned against fake tenant registration documents
news.para: Maharashtra housing societies are facing a surge in fraudulent tenant registration documents, prompting alerts from service providers. Forged leave and license agreements, often altered PDFs, are being submitted, potentially causing legal issues for landlords.

news.title: Additional 20% deposit for project registration extension: Tamil Nadu RERA
news.para: To protect homebuyers from project delays, TNRERA now requires developers seeking project registration extensions beyond a year to deposit an extra 20% of collected funds into the project account. This move aims to ensure sufficient funds for construction and prevent diversion. Small builders, however, worry about the impact on their cash flow, especially when delays are due to natural causes.

news.title: Builders in Noida seek rehabilitation policy over Sports City impasse
news.para: Developers are urging the UP government to implement a rehabilitation policy for Sports City projects, similar to the one for stalled group housing, to resolve long-standing dues. They propose paying 25% of recalculated dues within 60 days and the rest over three years.

news.title: HC stays YEIDA's order to cancel land allotted to Greenbay Infrastructure over ₹118 crore dues
news.para: The Allahabad High Court has temporarily prevented YEIDA from cancelling Greenbay Infrastructure's land allotment for its Sector 22D township project. This order is pending the state government's decision on Greenbay's request for relief under the 'zero period' policy, citing incomplete land possession.

news.title: Haryana RERA penalises Shine Buildcon for four-year delay in unit handover in Gurugram
news.para: Haryana Real Estate Regulatory Authority directed Shine Buildcon to pay interest to a complainant. The interest rate is 11.1% per annum for a delay in handing over a commercial unit. The project, '70 Grandwalk', faced a delay of over four years. HRera also addressed illegal charges levied by the developer.

news.title: NCLT excludes Phoenix ARC from committee of creditors in Hotel Horizon case
news.para: The NCLT partially approved Hotel Horizon's promoters' plea, excluding Phoenix ARC's claim from the CIRP due to limitation. Oberoi Realty's consortium secured CoC approval to acquire the company for Rs 919 crore. The tribunal instructed a claim rework for JMFARC and directed reverification of UBI's claims, while CFM ARC appeals the Phoenix ARC decision.

news.title: Sirca Paints' profit rises 39% to ₹14 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Sirca Paints India witnessed a significant surge in its consolidated net profit, soaring by 39.2% to reach Rs 14.20 crore in the first quarter, fueled by robust growth in both margin and sales. The company's revenue from operations also experienced a substantial increase of 45.26%, climbing to Rs 114.24 crore during the same period.

news.title: Godrej Properties plans its largest-ever bond issue: Sources
news.para: Godrej Properties is preparing to issue its largest corporate bond offering this month, aiming to raise approximately 20 billion rupees ($230 million). The real estate developer will offer shorter-duration bonds with maturities ranging from three to five years.

news.title: FIRs to curb illegal sand mining in Maharashtra
news.para: The Maharashtra government has ordered strict action against illegal sand mining, including FIRs and prosecutions under multiple laws. This directive empowers officials to act against offenders and prevent environmental damage, revenue loss, and threats to public order. Negligence by officials will result in disciplinary action, and repeat offenders may face preventive detention under the Sand Smugglers Act.

news.title: PM to inaugurate Bengaluru's yellow line metro on August 10
news.para: Narendra Modi, the Prime Minister, is set to visit Bengaluru on August 10. He will inaugurate the Yellow Line Metro. This project aims to ease traffic congestion. The Prime Minister will also initiate Metro Phase-3. This phase received quick approval. These projects are expected to benefit many commuters. The Yellow Line is expected to be operational by August 15.

news.title: Land records doctored for farmhouse colony, ACB files FIR against Ansals, ex-government officials
news.para: After a decade-long investigation, the anti-corruption bureau has filed an FIR against Ansal Housing and associated entities for allegedly manipulating land records in the Sohna Aravalis. Revenue officials are accused of illegally reclassifying protected land to enable the development of farmhouses, violating the Aravali Notification of 1992.

news.title: Visakhapatnam: Cherlopalikhandam township plan back on track after 18 years
news.para: A long-standing land dispute near Anakapalli has been resolved. This allows for the development of a 58-acre integrated township. The project faced delays since 2007 due to land consent issues. The government approved a compensation package for landowners. VMRDA officials believe the project is financially viable. The development will provide housing in a high-demand area.

news.title: MahaRERA says both physical and virtual hearings available after HC directive on hybrid option
news.para: MahaRERA clarified it offers both physical and virtual hearing options, responding to a Bombay High Court directive emphasizing the right to physical presence for justice. While virtual hearings are common, in-person hearings are available upon request. MahaRERA has implemented reforms for efficiency, including pre-notified order pronouncements and urgent matter listings.

news.title: In redevelopment deals, Mumbai residents sweat over fears of managing committee-builder nexus
news.para: In Mumbai's lucrative redevelopment market, housing society managing committees wield significant influence, often leading to underhand dealings with developers. While some committees act in the best interests of residents, others are allegedly involved in corruption, accepting bribes and preferential treatment in exchange for favoring specific builders. This raises concerns about transparency and fairness in redevelopment projects.

news.title: Allahabad HC directs Ghaziabad development body to maintain status quo on demolition notice
news.para: The Allahabad High Court has ordered a status quo on demolition notices issued by the Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) concerning alleged illegal properties on public land. The court has directed the district administration and GDA to present a rehabilitation plan for the long-term inhabitants, many from weaker sections, who have occupied the land for 40-50 years.

news.title: Bengaluru: E-khata data entry error lands owner huge tax bill
news.para: As per the sale deed, the built-up area is 1366 sq ft and the car parking area is 180 sq ft. However, the staff at BangaloreOne, despite undergoing a week-long training as claimed by the BBMP Chief Commissioner, mistakenly entered both the built-up area and car parking area as 1366 sq ft, resulting in an inaccurate property record.

news.title: Anand Automotive buys bungalow in Delhi for ₹195 crore
news.para: Auto component manufacturer Anand Automotive acquired a 1,550 square yard bungalow on Kautilya Marg in New Delhi for ₹195 crore, marking a significant property deal this year. This transaction, along with others by prominent figures like Anurag Jain and Aakash Chaudhry, highlights the surging demand for luxury properties among HNIs, driven by investment diversification and personal use preferences.
